title.narrative: Inproving food security and sanitation in Mali prefecture the republic of Guinea

description.narrative: The second fase of the project aims to reduce the effects of poverty and increase the well-being of the rural population in the Mali prefecture in Northern Guinea. The aim is reached by improving food security hygiene and by decreasing the effects of the c limate change. The target group is especially women and children of 33 villages. The aim will be achieved by growing leguminous plants (such as Cajanus cajan) and plants that are effective carbon binders. The hygiene and sanitation of the recidents is impr oved by organising trainings and conselling.This project will be concentrating in the even distribution of the harvest throughout the year and will be improving the conservation methods of the crops. The development of the more diverse diet will be followe d by a regular monitoring and trainings will be offered in all villages. By increasing the production of Gliridicia sepium it will be possible to reduce the damages caused by lifestock to the plantations. Gliricidia sepium can also be used as a firewood an d the leaves given as a fodder to lifestock during the dry season. The cultivation of Cafe Liberien will be increased as well as growing of fruit trees such as the avocado. The cultivation of the trees aims to increase the income of the beneficiaries in th e long run. The beneficiries will receive training and counselling in hygiene health and sanitation. The aim is to increase the knowledge of the prevention of the fecal-orally transmitted deceases. The use and functionality of the dry toilets built in 2018 will be closely followed the toilets will be used for training of the beneficiaries about ecological sanitation and the received information will be documented. The urine and compost will be used for test plantations and for the fields. The information ga thered of all the project activities and results will be registed to Web-based resource bank in French.
